text: Growler from Tree House, into a tulip glass. Pours heavily hazy milky light orange, medium white head fades quickly and laces well. Aroma is clean floral notes - passionfruit, lemon rind, light citrus. Taste is crisp, lightly juicy citrusy hops; floral notes of lime and mango stand out. Dry and clean on the finish, slight bitterness lingers but otherwise clean with very light mouthfeel. Loads of hops and opaque appearance leave this unidentifiable as a blonde, no complaints here. Incredibly rich and flavorful for a sub 4% abv beer, I cant recall any session beers that came close to this.

Canned 8/4/16, drunk 8/11 and another on 9/8/16.Incredibly hazy, multi-layered sunset hues, predominantly rosy-peach, with a white head atop showing strong retention.Fresh sliced pineapple rises up immediately out of the can. Light mandarin orange adds juicy sweetness as well, with a subtle Galaxy spiciness/dankness in the background. Succulent, honey drizzled peach emerges quickly, as the malt mixes with the fruitiness of the hop. Impeccably clean and with no resin or alcohol whatsoever. Not as much watermelon as I usually get from Tree House, but Eureka doesnt give that off as much as their IPAs do. Not as intense and lush as their IPAs, of course, being all of 4.1% but the aroma is still delightfully persistent and encompassing.Lovely pineapple-tangerine in the flavor is juicy as hell but also cut with a light graininess from the malt. Soft, but not to the point of reducing the crispness on the end. Very light bitterness, enough to balance, but the light citrus and pineapple does all the work here, with just a touch of spiciness from the hop lingering. Key lime, melon, guava, pretty much any tropical fruit you think of can be imagined in some form here. Tight carbonation, no alcohol, no flaw. Just a knockout. Some day, not particularly soon, I will be able to buy this in a store near me. That will be a good day.

Can. Pours a dense cloudy golden orange with a lasting thin foamy off white head. Aroma is of dank pine, citrus, biscuit, floral. Taste is of citrus, light exotic fruits, melon, hint of spice. Light oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
Nothing much to say here. Overall a good drink and quenches a thirst on on hot day with out having any real highs or lows.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2016 16oz can. Pours a hazy orange gold. Aroma of pine and mango. Taste of much the same. Watery initial taste of tropical fruit, bread, and light pine turns into a piney hop finish. Moderate carbonation. A thin but pleasant mouthfeel.  Tastes much closer to an APA than it does to a blonde ale.

Thanks Drew.
Canned 08/04/16.
This was poured into a becher pint glass.
The appearance was a hazy burnt orange color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated at a nice pace. Delicate speckled lacing around the glass.
The smell had sweet juicy citrus over some sweet fresh grass. Light resin. Tropical fruits enter in as it warms.
The flavor brings together all of the previously mentioned aromas sweetly with a delicate bitter to juicy underneath. Sharp bitter rind-like aftertaste and finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a nice sessionability about it. Carbonation rides nice and low. Crisp sweet to bitter dragging across my tongue.
Overall, my hidden bias might come out with this one, cause it probably leans closer to an AIPA than a blonde by appearance, aroma and flavor, but hey the feel, well, its definitely crushable, hot damn! Hell yeah, Id have again.

Poured from a can into a tulip: Pours hazy straw with a white head. Aroma is citrus fruits, straw, and pale malt with a little dough. Taste is more of the same, really sessionable citrus blonde. Nice beer!
Canned. Light lemon color. Small head. Aroma is dank, and tons of. Tropical fruit, mango, papaya, pineapple. Flavor is light spice, lemon, tropical fruits. So good for such a light beer.

Hazy golden body, medium sized white head, soapy lacing. Brigt tropical and citric notes, mild mellon, pine, a touch of grass and resin, and the slightest bit of crackery malt. Medium to light bodied with moderate carbonation, lively bitterness, and a nice dry finish.
Can at Bills, pours hazy golden shade with medium sized top and pretty solid lacing streaks. Flavors and smells are dank melon, pine, earth, and pineapple slices. Lots of flavor for 3.9% ! Cheers

Can at bills courtesy of Alan. Pours a bright hazy yellow golden body with white lacing. Mouthfeel is tart and sessionable with notes of fresh bright citrus, tropical flavors, melon, pineapple, fresh grass and melon.
Can - Pours cloudy yellow white head. Nose/taste of green onion, citrus, cracker malt - medium body.
Can. Light yellow with white head. Citrus, herbal and grassy aromas. Citrus and herbal tones, very light but hops still come through.

Can. Pours cloudy pale yellow with almost no head, but still manages to have some sticky, resinous lacing. Aroma is pineapple and mango juice, resinous hops, faint scallion, musky peach, white grape. Taste is pineapple, peach, and tropical notes with tons of grassy/herbal hops, fresh dough, biscuity malt, and a slightly piney finish. Low to medium carbonation. Just insane how much flavor is packed into such a drinkable beer. Love this.

Cloudy gold with rocky foamy white head ; aroma is citrusy sprucy hops; Flava is rich hops spicy piney and slightly tangy citrus fruity notes; feels light semi fizzy; finishes mildly dry grassy hoppy notes.

750ml growler shared thanks to Lukaduke! Pours cloudy pale yellow with a finger of head. Nose is juicy pineapple, citrus, lemon. Taste is soft juicy tropical fruits, light (but not thin) body, bright tasty citrus, touches of malt. Finish is balanced juicy citrus, mildly bitter. Great stuff!

Pours a hazy yellow golden color with two fingers of white foam. Nose is a pleasant mix of light cracker malt, citrus pith, unripe pineapple and a hint of pine. Palate follows nicely with great mix of citrus hop juice, soft mouthfeel, hints of earthy pine lingers in the bitterness. Highly drinkable, crushing this !

2 L growler pour on 4/24 and drank on 4/26. Pours a straw yellow with orange undertones. Thin white head that has some retention. Faint hoppy aroma. Sweet taste with a quick bitter finish. A sessionable blond ale with enough hops to make me happy but not ecstatic. Overall a pretty good beer.

64 oz growler filled April 19, 2014. Poured into a snifter. Bright hazy yellow/pale orange body with a thin cap of white foam. Nose is cracker malts and huge juicy hops. Mango and cantaloupe with a little grass. Just so damn inviting. Taste follows with a huge tropical wall of hops. Mango, papaya, and melons. Finishes dry with some crisp bready malts and a low IBU. Light carbonation and a super low abv makes this crazy drinkable. Not as good as the Citra version but its definitely up there. Eureka kicks ass!
Straight tasty sessionable blonde ale which is reminiscent of a Hill Farmstead blonde ale. Aroma is tropical and citrus fruits with some fresh cut grass. Tasty and chuggable.

750ml growler dated September 26, 2013. 3.9% ABV. Big thanks to Mark for this treat!

Pours quite hazy yellow with a one finger white head that settles to a small cap and leaves some good lacing behind on the glass.

Aroma is a nice dose of Galaxy hops with fruity notes, tropical fruit and citrus, underneath is some light bready malt notes with a hint of spice. Good strength.

Flavor is more of the same, tropical fruits, fruity and citrusy hops, bready malt backbone, a hint of spice, a hint of alcohol, pretty dry overall with good bitterness. 

Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied, a little sticky, good carbonation.

Ahhh a nice treat! I love Galaxy hops and they are showcased nicely in this Blonde Ale. Pretty light, crisp and refreshing. Tasty!
Pours pale orange gold with a white head. Aroma of wet cracker, tropical fruit, grapefruit. Sweet smooth light malt backbone with tangerine, mango and grapefruit flavors. Very juicy.

750ml growler poured into a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of galaxy hops, some light malts, a hint of grain/cereal common in Tree House beers, and a little dough. Flavor the same with a nice amount of hops. Average texture. A good beer for how light it is.
Growler straight from the source! Lightly galaxy, a great showcasing of the hop, this is fantastic, so delicate and tasty!

Special version of traditional Eureka brewers with Galaxy instead of Nelson. Pours a very hazy, but somewhat bright yellow. The aroma consists of tropical fruit notes and grapefruit rind. Hints of papaya. The flavor is rather bitter. Nice juicy palate.Packed with flavor for 3.9% ABV.
